channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22841] ThriftHttpServlet#getClientNameFromCookie should handle CookieSigner IllegalArgumentException on invalid cookie signature
item.description:
Currently CookieSigner throws an IllegalArgumentException if the cookie signature is invalid. 

if (!MessageDigest.isEqual(originalSignature.getBytes(), currentSignature.getBytes())) {
      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid sign, original = " + originalSignature +
        " current = " + currentSignature);
    }

CookieSigner is only used in the ThriftHttpServlet#getClientNameFromCookie and doesn't handle the IllegalArgumentException. It is only checking if the value from the cookie is null or not.

https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/service/src/java/org/apache/hive/service/cli/thrift/ThriftHttpServlet.java#L295

      currValue = signer.verifyAndExtract(currValue);
      // Retrieve the user name, do the final validation step.
      if (currValue != null) {

This should be fixed to either:
a) Have CookieSigner not return an IllegalArgumentException
b) Improve ThriftHttpServlet to handle CookieSigner throwing an IllegalArgumentException
item.summary: ThriftHttpServlet#getClientNameFromCookie should handle CookieSigner IllegalArgumentException on invalid cookie signature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This was introduced originally in HIVE-9710 and never touched since then.

Clients of HS2 never get back a 401 or any reason to invalidate the cookie. Just a 500 error from HS2.

Here is the stacktrace from HS2:

2020-02-06T14:42:44,600 WARN  [HiveServer2-HttpHandler-Pool: Thread-3263]: servlet.ServletHandler (:()) - /cliservice
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid sign, original = masked1 current = masked2
	at org.apache.hive.service.CookieSigner.verifyAndExtract(CookieSigner.java:85) ~[hive-service-3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1.jar:3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1]
	at org.apache.hive.service.cli.thrift.ThriftHttpServlet.getClientNameFromCookie(ThriftHttpServlet.java:259) ~[hive-service-3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1.jar:3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1]
	at org.apache.hive.service.cli.thrift.ThriftHttpServlet.validateCookie(ThriftHttpServlet.java:315) ~[hive-service-3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1.jar:3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1]
	at org.apache.hive.service.cli.thrift.ThriftHttpServlet.doPost(ThriftHttpServlet.java:144) ~[hive-service-3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1.jar:3.1.0.3.1.0.28-1]

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [?:1.8.0_112]

Here is from Knox in front of HS2:

==> /var/log/knox/gateway-audit.log <==
20/02/06 14:42:43 ||5cf0352a-e0e3-4b49-99f2-722714aa2ac3|audit|xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx|HIVE||||access|uri|/gateway/default/hive|unavailable|Request method: POST
20/02/06 14:42:44 ||5cf0352a-e0e3-4b49-99f2-722714aa2ac3|audit|xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx|HIVE|USER1|||authentication|uri|/gateway/default/hive|success|
20/02/06 14:42:44 ||5cf0352a-e0e3-4b49-99f2-722714aa2ac3|audit|xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx|HIVE|USER1|||authentication|uri|/gateway/default/hive|success|Groups: []
20/02/06 14:42:44 ||5cf0352a-e0e3-4b49-99f2-722714aa2ac3|audit|xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx|HIVE|USER1|||dispatch|uri|http://hs2.example.com:10001/cliservice?doAs=USER1|unavailable|Request method: POST
20/02/06 14:42:44 ||5cf0352a-e0e3-4b49-99f2-722714aa2ac3|audit|xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx|HIVE|USER1|||dispatch|uri|http://hs2.example.com:10001/cliservice?doAs=USER1|success|Response status: 500
20/02/06 14:42:44 |||audit|xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx|HIVE|USER1|||access|uri|/gateway/default/hive|success|Response status: 500

The 500 comes back from HS2 when the IllegalArgumentException is thrown from the cookie signer.

In the case of beeline you don't see this since this forces a disconnect and a new HTTP client on reconnect. Knox reuses the HttpClient so the old cookie is around and end up in a 500 loop.

Option b seems more reasonable since CookieSigner#verifyAndExtract is only used in one place. It doesn't require changing the signature of CookieSigner#verifyAndExtract. I'm working on a patch now.

As a side note the existing CookieSigner tests don't even check IllegalArgumentException.

I have a patch coming in for this probably tomorrow. I went with checking the IllegalArgumentException and that fixes the 500 error I was seeing. It fixes the interaction with Knox too.

I added some CookieSigner tests, but want to add a test in ThriftCliServiceTestWithCookie. It looks like ThriftCliServiceTestWithCookie has issues though outside of my change.

So I spent a bunch of time with ThriftCliServiceTestWithCookie and found the following:

  • There is a CNF exception since it was trying to load an authorizer from the itests
    • Due to the CNF, the test was never run - I think because of <failIfNoTests>false</failIfNoTests> in pom.xml
  • Once fixing the CNF, found that the test doesn't even test anything related to cookies
    • I walked through with a debugger and found that none of the cookie handling is used
    • The test uses internal clients and doesn't go through HTTP front door of HS2
    • So as written the test is useless.

This change also makes the result consistent between cookie auth and no cookie auth. Prior to this change if you were connected with cookieAuth from say beeline to HS2 and HS2 was restarted, you would get a 500 error and disconnect. Any other authentication besides cookieAuth returns a session not found error message. This change makes that consistent from cookieAuth as well.

Cookie authentication should not change the behavior of the connection.
Ok was able to create an itest for this that uses minihs2 and actually asserts real things with the cookies generated. It replaces ThriftCliServiceTestWithCookie since it wasn't doing anything.

Uploaded a patch [^HIVE-22841-1.patch]:

  • Enhances ThriftHttpServlet to handle IllegalArgumentException from CookieSigner
  • Ensures that cookiestore set on httpclient instead of using deprecated method for client context
    • this helps with testing as well since able to get cookiestore instead of it only being internal
  • Adds test cases to TestCookieSigner
  • Removes ThriftCliServiceTestWithCookie
  • Adds TestHttpCookieAuthenticationTest based on mini HS2 to test cookie auth

Checked that the tests failed without the fix to ThriftHttpServlet and pass afterwards.
FYI ngangam and thejas
Reattaching patch since no test run on the patch.

-1 overall
